summary: This bill, the American Infrastructure Bonds Act of 2025, amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide a tax credit to issuers of American infrastructure bonds. The Secretary of the Treasury will pay 28% of the interest payable on these bonds directly to the issuer. The bill defines an American infrastructure bond and includes provisions regarding interest inclusion in gross income, application of arbitrage rules, state law coordination, and adjustments for sequestration. The effective date is for obligations issued after the date of enactment.
